Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Game
public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
The class representing the game intended has the sequence of states and action that can be performed. The game is initialized and after every turn its state it's updated, following the action of the players and the game phases as stated by the rules.

    Constructors

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init​(java.util.List<Player> players, Deck deck, boolean simpleGame)
      Initialize the game, defining the initial state
      Parameters:
      players - The list of players
      deck - The deck, containing the list of Gods
      simpleGame - True for a simple game, skipping god selection

    • getModelEventProvider

      public IModelEventProvider getModelEventProvider()
      Obtain the IModelEventProvider, to be used to register model event observers
      Returns:
      The model event provider

    • getAllPlayers

      public java.util.List<Player> getAllPlayers()
      Obtain a copy of the game players
      Returns:
      The players This method has no side effect

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public Player getCurrentPlayer()
      Obtain the current player that is able to interact with the game If Game#isEnded returns true, this method returns the winner Calling this method repeatedly should not result in a different player unless other methods got called
      Returns:
      The Player

    • selectGods

      public ModelResponse selectGods​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> gods)
      Select the god cards to be used in the current game
      Parameters:
      gods - The list of the chosen god cards
      Returns:
      the response - If the arguments pass the related check, the response will be ALLOW

    • chooseGod

      public ModelResponse chooseGod​(java.lang.String god)
      Select the god card, between the available gods, to be used by the current player
      Parameters:
      god - The god card, must be still available
      Returns:
      the response - If the arguments pass the related check, the response will be ALLOW
